intro: Jacobaea macrophylla, commonly known as the giant ragwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its large, woolly leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its biennial or short-lived perennial growth habit. Jacobaea macrophylla can grow up to 2 meters tall, making it a prominent feature in its natural habitat. It is also notable for its toxic properties, containing pyrrolizidine alkaloids that are harmful to livestock.
